intro: Ammannia nuttallii, commonly known as prairie ammannia, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. This herbaceous perennial typically grows in wet or moist soils along stream banks and in prairie habitats. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from June to August. The plant has slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
